basics.name: Jaeyong Shin
basics.label: Ph.D. Student
basics.summary: Ph.D Student in Seoul National University. I am interested in Humanoid Robot, Reinforcement Learning.

publications.name: Analysis of Effects of Leg Inertia Distribution on Contact Stability and Dynamic Performance During Bipedal Walking
publications.publisher: Kim, Junhyung and Park, Beomyeong and Shin, Jaeyong and Park, Jaeheung
publications.summary: By concentrating leg inertia distribution near the hip, both contact stability and dynamic performance in bipedal walking are significantly enhanced, as confirmed by various simulation models.

publications.name: Intuitive and Interactive Robotic Avatar System for Tele-Existence: TEAM SNU in the ANA Avatar XPRIZE Finals
publications.publisher: Beomyeong Park, Donghyeon Kim, Daegyu Lim, Suhan Park, Junewhee Ahn, Seungyeon Kim, Jaeyong Shin, Eunho Sung, Jaehoon Sim, Junhyung Kim, Myeong-Ju Kim, Junhyeok Cha, Gyeongjae Park, Hokyun Lee, Seungbin You, Keunwoo Jang, Seung-Hun Kim, Mathew Schwartz & Jaeheung Park
publications.summary: This paper introduces a teleoperated robotic avatar system using a life-size humanoid robot (TOCABI) with a mobile base and multi-modal sensory feedback, enabling immersive and intuitive control. User studies and demonstrations at the ANA Avatar XPRIZE Finals confirmed its enhanced mobility and manipulation, successfully completing 8 out of 10 missions.

projects.name: Avatar XPRIZE
projects.summary: The Avatar XPRIZE aimed to create a robotic avatar system that could transport human presence to a remote location in real time.
highlights: Finalist in the ANA Avatar XPRIZE
